Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix violates robotstxt.org guidelines
 (If-modified-since etc)!
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=87661776; y=2SBN-ugPxHjyiw0q-hLIUUQLldQquDaB57D46Wo6OoAsW6zP5X4gLO0
X-Yahoo-Profile: michael_scharf

Hi,

thank you for your detailed reply!

 > http://netarchive.dk/website/publications/Etags-2004.pdf

The ETags document is very helpful for me...

The tool I'm working on is a kind of mixture between
offline browser, picture grabber, search engine and
a game... A few % misses on updates would not a problem.

I am surprised that etags/date and keep-alive
are not part of the archive.org crawler. Couldn't that
reduce the overall amount of spidered pages and
therefore being more polite?

I'd be interested in the HTTP/1.1 patches.
If I would get it to work, I'd like to
contribute it back.

Michael
